physical_appearance: This is a candle holder decorated with a dotted design. These are multicoloured dots on a white porcelain base. They each capture glimpses / parts of a floral and foliage decorative scheme.
sgcool_label_text: This candle holder is one of the five porcelain wares from the award-winning “Spotted Nyonya” series by Singaporean designer, Hans Tan.  This series is a contemporary take on traditional Peranakan porcelain or nyonyaware.  Hans Tan was inspired by batik, particularly the resist-dyeing technique, to transform the surface of these wares.  Original glazed portions are preserved in the form of a new dotted pattern while the white porcelain body is revealed after sandblasting away and erasing the original glaze on these pieces.  The combination of green and pink polychrome colours or dots on the original decoration of these pieces are typical of nyonyaware.  Motifs commonly found on nyonyaware would include realistically depicted birds and insects amongst floral sprays.
